Chief complaint.description: I feel exhausted and hopeless every day, and recently I started thinking about ending my life.

childhood history.home environment: She grew up in a lower-middle-class household in Busan with both parents and one younger brother; the environment was generally stable but tense when her father drank heavily.
childhood history.members of family: Father, mother, one younger brother; she is the eldest child.
childhood history.social environment: She had a small but close group of friends in elementary and middle school, with no history of significant bullying or social isolation.

Developmental_Social history.other history: She occasionally attends a Protestant church but has become less active in the past few months; no legal issues and no history of military service.
Developmental_Social history.school history: No special education needs; average academic performance in regular classes; no history of learning disorders or significant behavioral problems.
Developmental_Social history.work history: She has worked as an office administrative assistant for about 15 years at the same mid-sized trading company in Seoul, generally evaluated as reliable and organized; over the past year she reports decreased productivity, more mistakes, and increased tension with her demanding supervisor.

Family history.diagnosis_n: Her mother had recurrent depressive episodes in her 50s and was treated with antidepressant medication by a local psychiatrist.
Family history.substance_use_n: Her father was a heavy alcohol user with frequent binge drinking on weekends, which sometimes led to verbal conflicts at home.

Identifying data.occupation: Office administrative assistant at a trading company

Marriage_relationship history.current family structure: Married for 12 years, living in Seoul with her husband and a 9-year-old daughter in an apartment; reports increasing marital conflict over finances and shared responsibilities, but no physical violence.

Past medical history.history_n: Diagnosed with essential hypertension 3 years ago, well controlled; no history of major surgeries or other chronic illnesses.

symptom_n.alleviating factor: Brief distraction when focusing on work tasks or when talking with her daughter
symptom_n.exacerbating factor: Being alone at home in the evening and thinking about financial and marital problems
symptom_n.name: Depressed mood and loss of interest

symptom_n.alleviating factor: Taking over-the-counter sleep aids occasionally and listening to relaxation music
symptom_n.exacerbating factor: Ruminating about work mistakes and conflict with husband at night
symptom_n.name: Insomnia and early morning awakening

symptom_n.alleviating factor: Short walks during lunch break and encouragement from a close coworker
symptom_n.exacerbating factor: Increased workload, overtime, and criticism from her supervisor
symptom_n.name: Low energy, poor concentration, and psychomotor slowing

symptom_n.alleviating factor: Talking briefly with a close friend by phone and attending church occasionally
symptom_n.exacerbating factor: Arguments with husband, feeling like a burden to her family, and comparing herself with peers
symptom_n.name: Feelings of worthlessness, guilt, and recurrent suicidal thoughts

Present illness.triggering factor: One week ago she prepared to overdose on her prescription antihypertensive medication after an argument with her husband about money, but stopped after thinking about her daughter; her coworker then strongly urged her to seek psychiatric help.
